decks.notes: The deck focuses on using cheap cycling creatures and spells to quickly fill the graveyard and generate value from cards like Irencrag Pyromancer and Rielle, the Everwise. The ultimate goal is to cycle through the deck efficiently to either overwhelm the opponent with a big Zenith Flare or create a wide board with Valiant Rescuer and Improbable Alliance. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion option to recur key cycling creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes pathways for efficient mana fixing and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building advantage through card draw and creature removal. The goal is to quickly fill the opponent's graveyard with mill cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, while using counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Didn't Say Please to disrupt their plans. Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recursion of low-cost permanents for added value. Overall, the key concept is to control the game state and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of mill and control tactics.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of counter spells, removal, and card draw. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating incremental advantage through cards like Mazemind Tome and Omen of the Sea. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion that can reset the battlefield and provide additional value. With a mix of creature removal, board wipes, and card advantage, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and outlast them in a long game.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board control through various removal spells and counter magic while ramping into powerful threats. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and outvalue the opponent using cards like Yorion, Emergent Ultimatum, and Elder Gargaroth. By utilizing a mix of creature threats, removal spells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and ultimately win through late-game dominance. The inclusion of a companion in Yorion adds an additional element of consistency and value to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on using cycling cards to consistently draw cards, deal damage, and eventually win the game with the powerful Zenith Flare. The key strategy is to cycle through the deck quickly, building up a large number of cards in hand and activating abilities on cards like Drannith Stinger and Irencrag Pyromancer to chip away at the opponent's life total. The synergy between cycling cards, card draw, and direct damage creates a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad, Elder Gargaroth, and Emergent Ultimatum. The deck also has a ramp package with Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to ensure it can cast its high-cost spells like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Alrund's Epiphany. The mana base is built to support the three colors of green, blue, and black to consistently cast its spells.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to trigger powerful effects and deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Flourishing Fox, Drannith Stinger, and Zenith Flare, players can build a strong board presence and finish off opponents quickly. Cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Improbable Alliance help keep the cycling going, while Valiant Rescuer provides additional creatures to pressure the opponent. With efficient removal spells like Memory Leak and flexible options like Disdainful Stroke, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while aggressively cycling through its cards.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful removal spells and counterspells to control the board while ramping into big threats like Elder Gargaroth and Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive spells like Duress and Extinction Event to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through incremental advantages and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes while ramping up with land fetching spells. It aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Elder Gargaroth and Emergent Ultimatum. The deck also includes a toolbox of versatile cards like Valki, God of Lies and Polukranos, Unchained to adapt to different situations. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, stabilize the board, and eventually overwhelm them with big creatures and game-ending spells.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive white creatures while utilizing cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Selfless Savior to protect important pieces like Luminarch Aspirant and Elite Spellbinder. Drannith Magistrate disrupts opponent's game plans, while Reidane, God of the Worthy slows down the opponent's mana development. Faceless Haven provides a late-game threat, and Skyclave Apparition helps deal with problematic permanents. The deck aims to maintain board presence and apply consistent pressure to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By playing powerful creatures like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Bonecrusher Giant, along with the powerful equipment Embercleave, the deck aims to deal a lot of damage early in the game. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Castle Embereth help to increase the damage output even further. The deck also includes snow lands for synergy with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven for additional threats on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring as an additional resource, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Claim the Firstborn and Heartless Act. With a mix of powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bonecrusher Giant, alongside card advantage engines like Village Rites, the deck looks to close out games quickly and decisively.

The main focus of this Naya Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing the Companion Jegantha, the Wellspring and a mix of versatile creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, this deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Elite Spellbinder and Drannith Magistrate. Showdown of the Skalds provides additional card advantage and boosts the aggression of the deck, allowing for fast-paced victories through efficient combat and strategic play.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through powerful card advantage and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Elder Gargaroth, Polukranos, and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to generate incremental value in order to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, ramp, and powerful threats like Vorinclex and Kiora Bests the Sea God, the deck can adapt to different situations and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The companion Yorion provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra triggers and card advantage.

This deck revolves around fast and aggressive play, utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Immersturm Predator, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional versatility in the deck. Tricks like Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites help maintain tempo and card advantage, while cards like Valki, God of Lies and The Akroan War provide additional disruption. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in its aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control through removal spells and enchantments like "Binding the Old Gods," while ramping up mana with cards like "Cultivate" and "Wolfwillow Haven." The deck also aims to outvalue the opponent with big threats like "Elder Gargaroth" and "Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider," while utilizing cards like "Yorion, Sky Nomad" and "Alrund's Epiphany" for additional card advantage. The inclusion of counterspells like "Mystical Dispute" and board wipes like "Shadows' Verdict" help maintain control of the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy.
